rates.description: Hopping rates using classical or semi-classical expression

item.name: temperature
item.description: Temperature for rates given in Kelvin

item.name: method
item.description: Method chosen to compute rates. Can either be **marcus** or **jortner**. The first is the high temperature limit of Marcus theory, the second fallows the derivation by Jortner and Bixon

item.name: nmaxvib
item.description: If the method of choice is **jortner**, the maximal number of excited vibrations on the molecules has to be specified as an integer for the summation. The default value is 20

item.name: omegavib
item.description: If the method of choice is **jortner**, the vibration frequency of the quantum mode has to be given in units of eV. The default value is close to the CC bond-stretch at 0.2eV
